title: Tasmania to bring in new pokies rules to reduce harm | ABC NEWS
description: Proposed pokies reforms by the Tasmanian government will see longer closing hours for gaming areas in hotels and clubs.  It comes as a report commissioned by the government has found the cashless gaming card could increase gambling spend, unless other harm-reducing rules are put into place. description: As cost of living concerns grow, only half of Australians understand at least three basic financial concepts, and young people are the most financially illiterate demographic. There are calls for financial literacy classes to become a mandatory, stand-alone part of the school curriculum. description: *A warning for Indigenous viewers, this video contains images and names of people who have died.* As bushfire season approaches, one program is working to boost the number of First Nations people working in the NSW fire and rescue force. title: 12yo shark attack victim Nico Antic dies in hospital | ABC NEWS
description: Nico Antic, the 12-year-old boy who suffered serious leg injuries after being bitten by a shark in Sydney's east, has died in hospital. In a statement, his parents said they were "heartbroken" to share the news of their son's passing, and thanked first responders and hospital staff for everything they did to care for Nico. title: Once the ISIS capital, Raqqa locals hope Syria's wars are finally over | ABC NEWS
description: Al Naeem square was once dubbed the "Roundabout of Hell' when Islamic State fighters controlled the city of Raqqa in northen Syria and made it the capital of its proposed caliphate, using the square as a space for public executions.  But this week it was the scene for celebration as locals marked the withdrawal of Kurdish forces from the city, with the military under Syrian President Ahmed Al-Sharaa sweeping through the area.  Syrian government forces have wrested back control of vast parts of its territory in recent weeks, as the new president moves to assert control over the war-torn country. title: NATO outrage at Trump's Afghanistan comments | ABC NEWS
description: Veterans, NATO leaders and Prince Harry have reacted with anger after US President Donald Trump said veterans from other NATO member states avoided the front line in Afghanistan.  British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said the comments were "insulting and frankly appalling" and has called on Mr Trump to apologise. title: New Zealand landslide search moves to recovery | ABC NEWS
description: Human remains have been found under debris at the site of the landslide that devastated a campground on New Zealand's North Island three days ago.   Authorities have released the names and ages of the six people unaccounted-for:  Lisa Anne Maclennan, 50, from Morrinsville, New Zealand MÃ¥ns Loke Bernhardsson, 20, from Sweden Jacqualine Suzanne Wheeler, 71, from Rotorua, New Zealand Susan Doreen Knowles, 71, from Ngongotaha, New Zealand Sharon Maccanico, 15, from Auckland, New Zealand Max Furse-Kee, 15, from Auckland, New Zealand  Chief Coroner Judge Anna Tutton said a "painstakingly complex" process of identifying the remains would now take place.   "This is an unimaginably terrible time for those people who have lost the people they love," she said.  She said care would be taken to ensure any bodies found would be treated with dignity and any specific cultural needs would be adhered to as best as possible.   New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon said New Zealand was "full of grief", describing what happened at Mount Maunganui as "an absolute tragedy." title: 12yo shark bite victim Nico Antic dies almost a week after attack | ABC NEWS
description: A 12-year-old boy who was bitten by a shark in Sydney's east has died in hospital, almost a week after the attack. title: Search enters third day following Lake Cargelligo shooting | ABC NEWS
description: *WARNING: This video contains the names of Indigenous people who have died.* Police continue to search for Julian Ingram, also known as Julian Pierpoint, in connection to a fatal shooting at Lake Cargelligo in New South Wales on Thursday.  Two women and a man have died, and a 19-year-old was seriously injured.  Authorities say Mr Ingram, a 37-year-old council worker, could remain undetected in the area for some time, and have warned locals not to approach the gunman if he is sighted.
